movie.title: Jazz on a Summer's Day
movie.description_intro: Set at the Newport jazz festival in 1958, this documentary mixes images of water and the town with performers and audience. The film progresses from day to night and from improvisational music to Gospel. It's a concert film that suggests peace and leisure, jazz at a particular time and place.
movie.description_full: Set at the Newport jazz festival in 1958, this documentary mixes images of water and the town with performers and audience. The film progresses from day to night and from improvisational music to Gospel. It's a concert film that suggests peace and leisure, jazz at a particular time and place.

movies.title: A Place Out of Time: The Bordentown School
movies.title_english: A Place Out of Time: The Bordentown School
movies.title_long: A Place Out of Time: The Bordentown School (2009)
movies.summary: For a seventy-year period, when America cared little about the education of African-Americans, and discrimination was law and custom, The Bordentown School was an educational utopia. An incubator for black pride and intellect, it taught values, discipline, and life skills to generations of black children. This is the story of that remarkable school, as told by Bordentown alumni, historians, and remarkable archival footage. It is also the story of black education in America across three centuries, presenting a nuanced, rarely seen portrait of a separate black space; and a much-needed preface to the growing national discussion about historically black institutions and their role in nurturing identity and accomplishment. What was lost and what was gained in the march toward equality?

What was lost and what was gained in the march toward equality?

movies.title: Jimmy Carter: Rock & Roll President
movies.summary: Jimmy Carter's election to the presidency of the United States in 1977 was helped by the links that this fan of pop music had with stars.
movies.description_full: Jimmy Carter's election to the presidency of the United States in 1977 was helped by the links that this fan of pop music had with stars.
movies.synopsis: Jimmy Carter's election to the presidency of the United States in 1977 was helped by the links that this fan of pop music had with stars.

movies.title: Breslin and Hamill: Deadline Artists
movies.summary: Two men defined newspaper reporting in late 20th century New York. They understood the streets, the people and events that shape their lives. Jimmy Breslin and Pete Hamill mark the end of a tradition, city reporters telling the story of their city while presiding over the death of their trade. They were more than writers. This film is a history of their work and their lives told in their words because no one else is qualified to tell the tale.

movies.title: When the World is Shaken
movies.summary: The coronavirus left its mark worldwide with personal impact. Franklin Graham shares an intimate message on how to respond to the storms of life.
movies.description_full: The coronavirus left its mark worldwide with personal impact. Franklin Graham shares an intimate message on how to respond to the storms of life.
